name: Boris Razon
background: Boris Razon serves as Director of Editorial Content at ARTE France. Focus areas: Overall editorial strategy. They are looking for: Intellectually stimulating, culturally enriching content with European relevance and creative ambition.
thematic_priorities: Intellectually stimulating, culturally enriching content with European relevance and creative ambition
Premium documentary content with European cultural relevance
Feature-length documentaries (52–90 minutes) with strong artistic vision
Creative documentary approaches that push boundaries
Cultural documentaries exploring European identity and perspectives
Social documentaries with intellectual depth and artistic treatment
Historical documentaries with fresh intellectual perspectives
Science documentaries combining intellectual depth with visual innovation
Arts documentaries on major cultural figures or movements
target_audience: Culturally engaged audiences in France and Europe
budget_parameters: Documentary: €200K–€400K per hour; Specialist Factual: €220K–€450K per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: 3–5 page treatment with premise, approach and artistic vision
additional_info: Ongoing commissioning cycles; submissions accepted year-round unless strand-specific. Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach. Emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen. Encouragement of sustainable production practices. Support for projects across French regions (where applicable). Open to pitches from independent producers/companies.
